results.definition: soft fine feathers
(American football) a complete play to advance the football
examples: you have four downs to gain ten yards

results.definition: English physician who first described Down's syndrome (1828-1896)
(usually plural) a rolling treeless highland with little soil
fine soft dense hair (as the fine short hair of cattle or deer or the wool of sheep or the undercoat of certain dogs)
drink down entirely
examples: He downed three martinis before dinner
She killed a bottle of brandy that night
They popped a few beer after work

results.definition: eat immoderately
examples: Some people can down a pound of meat in the course of one meal

results.definition: bring down or defeat (an opponent)
shoot at and force to come down
examples: the enemy landed several of our aircraft

results.definition: cause to come or go down
examples: The policeman downed the heavily armed suspect
The mugger knocked down the old lady after she refused to hand over her wallet

results.definition: improve or perfect by pruning or polishing
examples: refine one's style of writing

results.definition: being or moving lower in position or less in some value
examples: lay face down
the moon is down
our team is down by a run
down by a pawn
the stock market is down today

results.definition: extending or moving from a higher to a lower place
examples: the down staircase
the downward course of the stream

results.definition: becoming progressively lower
examples: the down trend in the real estate market

results.definition: being put out by a strikeout
examples: two down in the bottom of the ninth

results.definition: understood perfectly
examples: had his algebra problems down

results.definition: lower than previously
examples: the market is depressed
prices are down

results.definition: shut
examples: the shades were down

results.definition: not functioning (temporarily or permanently)
examples: we can't work because the computer is down

results.definition: filled with melancholy and despondency
examples: gloomy at the thought of what he had to face
gloomy predictions
a gloomy silence
took a grim view of the economy
the darkening mood
lonely and blue in a strange city
depressed by the loss of his job
a dispirited and resigned expression on her face
downcast after his defeat
feeling discouraged and downhearted

results.definition: spatially or metaphorically from a higher to a lower level or position
examples: don't fall down
rode the lift up and skied down
prices plunged downward

results.definition: away from a more central or a more northerly place
examples: was sent down to work at the regional office
worked down on the farm
came down for the wedding
flew down to Florida

results.definition: paid in cash at time of purchase
examples: put ten dollars down on the necklace

results.definition: from an earlier time
examples: the story was passed down from father to son

results.definition: to a lower intensity
examples: he slowly phased down the light until the stage was completely black

results.definition: in an inactive or inoperative state
examples: the factory went down during the strike
the computer went down again
